description: Latin debilitatus, past participle of debilitare (“to weaken, debilitate”), from the adjective debilis (“weak”), from de- + habilis (“able”) (de- +‎ ability +‎ -ate).

verbs.description: debilitate (third-person singular simple present debilitates, present participle debilitating, simple past and past participle debilitated)

examples: The American Dream suffered a debilitating effect after the subprime crisis.
